title: Breast Cancer: Resources
author: WebMD Editorial Contributors

content: The American Cancer Society has information on breast cancer and most other types of cancer .

content_blocks.text: The American Cancer Society has information on breast cancer and most other types of cancer .

content: The Susan G. Komen Foundation supports research and community-based outreach programs related to breast cancer.

content_blocks.text: The Susan G. Komen Foundation supports research and community-based outreach programs related to breast cancer.

content: The National Breast Cancer Foundation works to increase breast cancer awareness and to provide mammograms for those in need.

content_blocks.text: The National Breast Cancer Foundation works to increase breast cancer awareness and to provide mammograms for those in need.

content: The National Cancer Institute is part of the U.S. National Institutes of Health (NIH).

content_blocks.text: The National Cancer Institute is part of the U.S. National Institutes of Health (NIH).

content: Young Survival Coalition is an international nonprofit group that is dedicated to the concerns and issues of young women with breast cancer.

content_blocks.text: Young Survival Coalition is an international nonprofit group that is dedicated to the concerns and issues of young women with breast cancer.

content: The Intercultural Cancer Council promotes cancer research, policies, programs, and partnerships in racial and ethnic minorities as well as medically underserved groups in the U.S.

content_blocks.text: The Intercultural Cancer Council promotes cancer research, policies, programs, and partnerships in racial and ethnic minorities as well as medically underserved groups in the U.S.

content: Sisters Network, Inc. is a breast cancer survivors' organization for African-American women. Its goal is to increase awareness of breast cancer in the black community and to reduce the higher rates of mortality from breast cancer among black women.

content_blocks.text: Sisters Network, Inc. is a breast cancer survivors' organization for African-American women. Its goal is to increase awareness of breast cancer in the black community and to reduce the higher rates of mortality from breast cancer among black women.

content: SHARE Cancer Support is a nonprofit organization that offers educational resources, a helpline, and support groups for women affected by breast, ovarian, uterine or metastatic breast cancer, with a special focus on medically underserved communities.

content_blocks.text: SHARE Cancer Support is a nonprofit organization that offers educational resources, a helpline, and support groups for women affected by breast, ovarian, uterine or metastatic breast cancer, with a special focus on medically underserved communities.

meta_description: There are many resources for those with breast cancer and their loved ones. WebMD shows you what's available.
